title: Datasets & Software
text:
To foster transparency and collaboration within the software engineering community, and in support of Open Science practices, I share below my datasets and tools to facilitate replication, reuse, and verification.


Experimental Package: Exploring Empathy in Software Engineering Articles ğŸ“Š Dataset


Lidiany Cerqueira. (Zenodo (v1.5))


Contains all files, scripts, and instructions needed to replicate the data collection and analysis process for gathering and analyzing grey literature articles about empathy in software engineering from DEV.to and Medium, as well as a follow-up expert survey used to assess the resulting framework. Supplementary material of the paper â€œExploring Empathy in Software Engineering: Insights from a Grey Literature Analysis of Practitionersâ€™ Perspectivesâ€ published at ACM Transactions on Software Engineering and Methodology (TOSEM). RAG-Coder: A Framework for Augmenting Qualitative Analysis - Beta Release ğŸ’» Software


Lidiany Cerqueira. (Zenodo (v1.0.1))


RAG-Coder is a Python-based framework for semi-automating the qualitative analysis of open-ended survey data using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) strategies. The framework is part of the paper: â€œRAG-Coder: A Framework for Augmenting Qualitative Analysis in Empirical Software Engineeringâ€ by Lidiany Cerqueira and Renan Guerra, 2025.




Dissertation Empirical Package - Empathy-Guided Software Development: A Conceptual Framework of Empathy in Software Engineering ğŸ“Š Dataset

This repository contains the datasets, scripts, and materials derived from the dissertation. The data is organized into three folders, each corresponding to a chapter.

CERCA is an open-source research tool that supports verification of bibliographic references in scientific manuscripts. title: Lidiany Cerqueira
text:
Lidiany Cerqueira is a Senior Software Engineer and Computer Science researcher working at the intersection of software engineering and human values. With over 15 years of industry experience and a PhD in Computer Science, her research interests include software engineering, human-centered computing, and empirical research.
She is a pioneer in the empirical study of empathy as a core human factor in software engineering, examining its effects on productivity, software quality, developersâ€™ well-being, collaboration, and mental health. She has published in leading venues, including ACM TOSEM and IEEE Software.
ğŸ† Her research has been recognized with a Distinguished Paper Award at the 2023 Brazilian Symposium on Software Engineering, Research Track and a finalist placement for Best Paper in the Industry Track at the 2024 International Conference on Enterprise Information Systems (ICEIS).

title: Projects
text:
My work focuses on the intersection of human-centric software engineering, open science tools, and the application of Generative AI in empirical research.


Cross-cultural investigation of empathy in SE ğŸŒ Research Initiative


Role: Principal Investigator


I am leading a new international initiative exploring empathy across diverse cultural work settings. We are currently conducting comparative case studies and interviews, starting with software teams in Portugal and Botswana, to understand how cultural context influences empathic behavior in engineering.
